wikipedia_page.main: Sir Robert Wright DSO OBE (1 March 1915 – 4 December 1981) was a senior British surgeon; a former President of the General Medical Council of Great Britain and former President of the Royal College of Physicians and Surgeons of Glasgow.

response: *Sir Robert Wright (judge, died 1689) (c. 1634–1689), Lord Chief Justice of England, 1687–1688
*Robert Wright (Chief Justice of South Carolina) (1666–1739), Chief Justice of South Carolina from 1725
*Robert Wright, Baron Wright (1869–1964), British law lord
*Robert Wright (English cricketer) (1852–1891), English first-class cricketer

*Robert Wright (British historian) (1906–1992), Royal Air Force historian and biographer of Hugh Dowding

*Sir Robert Wright (surgeon) (1915–1981), British surgeon
*Robert Wright (musical writer) (1914–2005), American composer and lyricist of musicals

*Robert Wright (Calvinist priest) (1556–1624), English Anglican priest

*Robert Wright (courtier) (1553–1596), English scholar and courtier
*Sir Robert Wright (RAF officer) (born 1947), British air marshal
*Robert Wright (journalist) (born 1957), American journalist and author of books popularizing evolutionary psychology and game theory
*Robert Wright (special effects artist), American special effects artist

response: * Sir Robert Wright DSO OBE, surgeon; President of the General Medical Council; Fellow, Royal College of Physicians; President, Royal College of Physicians and Surgeons of Glasgow; Fellow, Royal College of Surgeons of Edinburgh; Honorary Fellow, Royal Australasian College of Surgeons; Honorary Fellow, Royal College of Surgeons of England
